Author: Slyris#2880

Content: for reference version, i dont see so much need

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though i guess the fullnode side will likely be the production version...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for now, i am not worried about optimizations, more just getting it to work so it can be used as a spec

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Ok !

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: No problem

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: i will check the rest of the code and ask you if i dont undesrtand something

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks, not worried about small stuff, just that it makes sense and works

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: to be honest i trust you on the behavior, because it's your idea, and if the tests are going well, i dont worry

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: I was thinking that performance was mandatory for you that's why i tell you that minor things

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: i will focus on the behavior and critical error if i find

Content: most concerned i forgot some field in some structures in the (de)serialization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or forgot to initialize some variable before using it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes for the interface functions, there will be c++ stuff as it is interfacing to c++ code

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i did minimize it a lot though, so a pure C implementation wont be too much changes, but it didnt make sense to convert the C++ interface to the c++ code to C

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: i think for future pure C implementation we can think about something like ceeds to make our life easier

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: So it's will be more pleaseant to write

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it only took a day to get it all in place, i just didnt want to spend time getting familiar with some new tools

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: i understand you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on a strict schedule. today was to get the fullnode side as close to code complete as possible

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Perfectly understandable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tomorrow is to get the client side done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so that last function will be totally redone anyway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am finding that a 12000 utxo address is taking fraction of a second, so i can change the client side model to being a single threaded one

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which will simplify the logic a lot and still i think the transaction can be constructed and sent within a few seconds, though for many vin tx i will need to rethink the one request per second limitation on proof queries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: anyway, i will think on how to make the client side easy to understand and flexible
